definitions.definition: A container like an open bucket (usually to hold and carry coal).
A broad, shallow basket.
A dish, platter or a trencher.
A small hatch or opening in a boat. Also, small opening in a boat or ship for draining water from open deck.
A hatch that provides access to the roof from the interior of a building.
To cut a hole or holes through the bottom, deck, or sides of (as of a ship), for any purpose.
To deliberately sink one's ship or boat by any means, usually by order of the vessel's commander or owner.
(by extension, in figurative use) Undermine or thwart oneself (sometimes intentionally), or denigrate or destroy one's position or property; compare scupper.
definitions.example: The candidate had scuttled his chances with his unhinged outburst.

definitions.definition: A quick pace; a short run.
To move hastily, to scurry.
A narcotics addict, especially a heroin user.
(by extension) An enthusiast of something.
definitions.example: English people are travel junkies, but Americans hardly ever leave their state.

definitions.definition: One who does hair styling, manicures, and other beauty treatments.
A herb of the mint family, Origanum majorana, having aromatic leaves.
The leaves of this plant used in flavouring food.
Any of various edible fish, of the genus Tilapia, native to Africa and the Middle East but naturalized worldwide.
The overuse, by an individual or state, of the carbon dioxide absorption capacity of the world's oceans, vegetation and soil
A rough, prickly husk around the seeds or fruit of some plants.
Any of several plants having such husks.
A rotary cutting implement having a selection of variously shaped heads.
A tree growth in which the grain has grown in a deformed manner.
Wood of a mottled veneer, usually cut from such a growth.
A knot or lump in thread or cloth.
A sharp, pointy object, such as a sliver or splinter.
A bur; a seed pod with sharp features that stick in fur or clothing.
A small piece of material left on an edge after a cutting operation.
A thin flat piece of metal, formed from a sheet by punching; a small washer put on the end of a rivet before it is swaged down.
A broad iron ring on a tilting lance just below the grip, to prevent the hand from slipping.
The ear lobe.
The knot at the bottom of an antler.
A rough humming sound.
A uvular "r".
A metal ring at the top of the hand-rest on a spear.
Any of various insects of the suborder Zygoptera that have long slender bodies, and are similar to dragonflies but having wings folded when at rest.
A person who operates a ranch.
A ranch-style house.
(used as a title) A Hindu ascetic or religious teacher.
An explosion or sudden report made by the near-instantaneous decomposition or combustion of unstable substances. Specifically, combustion that spreads supersonically via shock compression.
definitions.example: the detonation of gun cotton

definitions.definition: Engine knocking, an improper combustion in internal combustion engines
To build as, or cover with a vault.
To jump or leap over.
definitions.example: The fugitive vaulted over the fence to escape.

definitions.definition: Of a ceiling supported by arches, introduced in the Gothic style.
A gender system in which people are categorized, in terms of gender and often also sex, exclusively as either male or female.
The area of law pertaining to crime and punishment.
A specific statute, ordinance, regulation, or other source of law that deems an action to be a crime.
Communication between two parties or groups.
Co-operation, working together.
A relayer of information between two forces in an army or during war.
A tryst, romantic meeting.
An illicit sexual relationship or affair.

The phonological fusion of two consecutive words and the manner in which this occurs, for example intrusion, consonant-vowel linking, etc. In the context of some languages, such as French, liaison can refer specifically to a normally silent final consonant, being pronounced when the next word begins with a vowel, and can often also include the intrusion of a "t" in certain fixed chunks of language such as the question form "pense-t-il".
To liaise.
A kind of cutting tool, used to cut the teeth of a gear.
The flat projection or iron shelf at the side of a fire grate, where things are put to be kept warm.
The top cooking surface on a cooker; a cooktop. It typically comprises several cooking elements (often four), also known as 'rings'.
A rounded peg used as a target in several games, especially in quoits.
A male ferret.
The hub of a wheel.
To create (a gear) by cutting with a hob.
To engage in the process of cutting gears with a hob.
A fairy; a sprite; an elf; a bogey.
A countryman; a rustic or yokel.
Deliberately misleading or cheating.
Deceptive, two-faced.
A keen-edged knife of peculiar shape, used in shaving the hair from the face or other parts of the body.
Any tool or instrument designed for shaving.
The sharp tusk of a wild boar.
A conceptual device that allows one to shave away unlikely explanations for a phenomenon.
definitions.example: Occam's razor, Hanlon's razor

definitions.definition: To shave with a razor.
An Asian plant, of the species Fagopyrum esculentum.
The fruit of this plant used as a pseudocereal.
Any of the wild buckwheats in the genus Eriogonum.
One who gives an anesthetic.
An operation.
definitions.example: My mother's going in for her knee op today.

definitions.definition: An amateur radio operator.
An operator on IRC, who can moderate the chat channel, ban users, etc.
Op art; a style of abstract art.
definitions.example: an op painting; op artworks

definitions.definition: To promote (an IRC user) to an operator.
Initialism of Overall Position.
Initialism of online pharmacy.
Initialism of opposite prompt; stage right,
Initialism of original poster; the person who started a thread.
definitions.example: I don't think your response really answers the OP's question.

definitions.definition: Initialism of original post.
Initialism of opening theme.
A lookout or vantage point
The credits shown at the beginning of a film, TV program, etc.
Any ester of phosphoric acid or its derivatives, especially one used as an insecticide or herbicide.
The loss of hope or confidence; despair or dejection.
A feeling of depression or disheartenment.
Half of a school year or academic year such as fall or spring semester.
A period or term of six months.
Magnetic tape used to record both video images and sound for subsequent playback or broadcasting
To make a recording of something on videotape
Study of the forms of life existing in prehistoric or geologic times, especially as represented by fossils.
A person, especially a man or a boy, who is pampered and overprotected.
To be overprotective and indulgent toward; to pamper.
A low soft shoe that can be slipped on and off easily.
Such a shoe intended for indoor use; a bedroom or house slipper.
definitions.example: Get out of bed, put on your slippers, and come downstairs.

definitions.definition: A flip-flop (type of rubber sandal).
A person who slips.
A kind of apron or pinafore for children.
A kind of brake or shoe for a wagon wheel.
A piece, usually a plate, applied to a sliding piece, to receive wear and permit adjustment; a gib.
A form of corporal punishment where the buttocks are repeatedly struck with a plimsoll; "the slipper".
The plimsoll or gym shoe used in this form of punishment.
To spank with a plimsoll as corporal punishment.
Slippery
definitions.example: O! trustless state of earthly things, and slipper hope / Of mortal men. — Spenser.

definitions.definition: To make or become dull or overcast.
Made of lead.
Pertaining to or resembling lead; grey, heavy, sluggish.
Dull; darkened with overcast.
definitions.example: the sky was leaden and thick

definitions.definition: Something that is an option or that may be elected, like a course of tertiary study or a medical procedure.
Of, or pertaining to voting or elections; involving a choice between options.
Optional or discretionary; chosen, not mandatory.
definitions.example: My insurance wouldn't pay for the operation because it was elective surgery.

definitions.definition: To arrive, come (to a place).
To come about; happen; come into being; arise.
definitions.example: It hath becomen so that many a man had to sterve.

definitions.definition: Begin to be; turn into.
definitions.example: She became a doctor when she was 25.

definitions.definition: To be proper for; to beseem.
Of an adornment, piece of clothing etc.: to look attractive on (someone).
definitions.example: That dress really becomes you.

definitions.definition: The act or process by which something becomes.
Pleasingly suitable; fit; congruous; beautiful
Decent, respectable
The act of one who labors; toil; work done.
To toil, to work.
To belabour, to emphasise or expand upon (a point in a debate, etc).
definitions.example: I think we've all got the idea. There's no need to labour the point.

definitions.definition: To be oppressed with difficulties or disease; to do one's work under conditions which make it especially hard or wearisome; to move slowly, as against opposition, or under a burden.
To suffer the pangs of childbirth.
To pitch or roll heavily, as a ship in a turbulent sea.
A competition in which participants compete for a determination that one is the most physically attractive.
An elaborate public display, especially a parade in historical or traditional costume.
A spectacular ceremony.
A wheeled platform for the exhibition of plays, etc.
To exhibit in show; to represent; to mimic.
Someone or something which times.
A device used to measure amounts of time.
Any electronic function that causes a device to be able to do something automatically after a preset amount of time.
Tedium as a result of repetition or a lack of variety.
The property of a monotonic function.
The quality of having an unvarying tone or pitch.
A living organism (originally a plant) produced asexually from a single ancestor, to which it is genetically identical.
A group of identical cells derived from a single cell.http//www.medterms.com/script/main/art.asp?articlekey=2754
A copy or imitation of something already existing, especially when designed to simulate it.
Two people who are exactly alike, as far as looks or behavior.
To create a clone of.
definitions.example: The scientists were able to clone a sheep.

definitions.definition: A booth on a toll road or toll bridge where the toll is collected.

(In this sense usually spelt tolbooth) The traditional municipal building of a Scottish town or burgh, usually including a meeting-hall, court, prison and (eponymically) a place for the receipt of taxes, duties and fines.
A hamburger.
(chiefly as a combining form) A similar sandwich or patty.
A citizen of a borough or town, especially one belonging to the middle class.
A prosperous member of the community; a middle class citizen (may connote complacency).
A demographic term for a person from the generation born from around the early 1980s to the mid 1990s or early 2000s; individuals who reached adulthood early in the 3rd millennium, C.E.
Referring to the 1,000th anniversary of an event or happening.
definitions.example: millennial fair

definitions.definition: Occurring every thousand years.
Occurring at the end or beginning of a millennium.
Of or relating to people born in the last two decades of the 20th century.
definitions.example: He was suffering from a typical millennial problem: Which is the correct emoji to use?

definitions.definition: Referring to the millennium, the period of one thousand years during which Christ will reign on earth.
definitions.example: the millennial judgment

definitions.definition: A religious custom.
(by extension) A prescribed behavior.
Straight, not bent.
definitions.example: a right line

definitions.definition: Of an angle, having a size of 90 degrees, or one quarter of a complete rotation; the angle between two perpendicular lines.
definitions.example: The kitchen counter formed a right angle with the back wall.

definitions.definition: Of a geometric figure, incorporating a right angle between edges, faces, axes, etc.
definitions.example: a right triangle, a right prism, a right cone

definitions.definition: Complying with justice, correctness or reason; correct, just, true.
definitions.example: I thought you'd made a mistake, but it seems you were right all along.

definitions.definition: Appropriate, perfectly suitable; fit for purpose.
definitions.example: Is this the right software for my computer?

definitions.definition: Healthy, sane, competent.
definitions.example: I'm afraid my father is no longer in his right mind.

definitions.definition: Real; veritable (used emphatically).
definitions.example: You've made a right mess of the kitchen!

definitions.definition: All right; not requiring assistance.
Most favourable or convenient; fortunate.
Designating the side of the body which is positioned to the east if one is facing north. This arrow points to the reader's right: →
definitions.example: After the accident, her right leg was slightly shorter than her left.

definitions.definition: Designed to be placed or worn outward.
definitions.example: the right side of a piece of cloth

definitions.definition: Pertaining to the political right; conservative.
On the right side.
Towards the right side.
Exactly, precisely.
definitions.example: Luckily we arrived right at the start of the film.

definitions.definition: Immediately, directly.
definitions.example: Can't you see it? It's right beside you!

definitions.definition: Very, extremely, quite.
definitions.example: I made a right stupid mistake there, didn't I?

definitions.definition: According to fact or truth; actually; truly; really.
In a correct manner.
definitions.example: Do it right or don't do it at all.

definitions.definition: (still used in some titles) To a great extent or degree.
definitions.example: Members of the Queen's Privy Council are styled The Right Honourable for life.

definitions.definition: Yes, that is correct; I agree.
I agree with whatever you say; I have no opinion.
Signpost word to change the subject in a discussion or discourse.
Used to check agreement at the end of an utterance.
definitions.example: You're going, right?

definitions.definition: Used to add seriousness or decisiveness before a statement.
That which complies with justice, law or reason.
definitions.example: We're on the side of right in this contest.

definitions.definition: A legal, just or moral entitlement.
definitions.example: You have no right to go through my personal diary.

definitions.definition: The right side or direction.
definitions.example: The pharmacy is just on the right past the bookshop.

definitions.definition: The right hand or fist.
The ensemble of right-wing political parties; political conservatives as a group.
definitions.example: The political right holds too much power.

definitions.definition: The outward or most finished surface, as of a coin, piece of cloth, a carpet, etc.
A wave breaking from right to left (viewed from the shore).
The act of grazing; a scratching or injuring lightly on passing.
A light abrasion; a slight scratch.
The act of animals feeding from pasture.
To feed or supply (cattle, sheep, etc.) with grass; to furnish pasture for.
definitions.example: 1999: Although it is perfectly good meadowland, none of the villagers has ever grazed animals on the meadow on the other side of the wall. — Stardust, Neil Gaiman, page 4 (2001 Perennial Edition).

definitions.definition: To feed on; to eat (growing herbage); to eat grass from (a pasture)
definitions.example: Cattle graze in the meadows.

definitions.definition: To tend (cattle, etc.) while grazing.
To eat periodically throughout the day, rather than at fixed mealtimes.
To shoplift by consuming food or drink items before reaching the checkout.
To rub or touch lightly the surface of (a thing) in passing.
definitions.example: the bullet grazed the wall

definitions.definition: To cause a slight wound to; to scratch.
definitions.example: to graze one's knee

definitions.definition: To yield grass for grazing.
Saturday, observed in Judaism and some Christian denominations as a day of rest and worship.
Sunday, observed in most of Christianity as a day of rest and worship.
Friday, observed in Islam as a day of rest and worship.
definitions.example: There are three Sabbaths–Friday (Muslim), Saturday (Jewish), and Sunday (Christian).

definitions.definition: A meeting of witches. (Also called a witches' sabbath, sabbat or black sabbath.)
Among the ancient Jews and Hebrews, the seventh year, when the land was left fallow.
A small falcon, Falco columbarius, that breeds in northern North America, Europe, and Asia.
A cytoskeletal protein active in the suppression of tumors.
Preference, bias in favor of, tendency.
definitions.example: The judge's partiality towards the defendant caused him to be replaced, with someone who was apparently more neutral.

definitions.definition: The quality of being partial or incomplete.
The act of evacuating; leaving a place in an orderly fashion, especially for safety.
Withdrawal of troops or civils from a town, fortress, etc.
The act of emptying, clearing of the contents, or discharging, including creating a vacuum.
Voidance of any matter by the natural passages of the body or by an artificial opening; defecation; also, a diminution of the fluids of an animal body by cathartics, venesection, or other means.
That which is evacuated or discharged; especially, a discharge by stool or other natural means.
Abolition; nullification.
A fast-moving streak of light in the night sky caused by the entry of extraterrestrial matter into the earth's atmosphere: A shooting star or falling star.

Any atmospheric phenomenon. (Thus the derivation of meteorology.) These were sometimes classified as aerial or airy meteors (winds), aqueous or watery meteors (hydrometeors: clouds, rain, snow, hail, dew, frost), luminous meteors (rainbows and aurora), and igneous or fiery meteors (lightning and shooting stars).
A prop similar to poi balls, in that it is twirled at the end of a cord or cable.
A striking weapon resembling a track and field hammer consisting of a weight swung at the end of a cable or chain.
Any short-lived source of wonderment.
To move at great speed.
In harness racing, a horse with a gait in which the front and back legs on opposite sides take a step together alternating with the other set of opposite legs; as opposed to a pacer.
The foot of a pig, sheep, or other quadruped.
The rounded portion of a ship's hull, forming a transition between the bottom and the sides.
The lowest inner part of a ship's hull, where water accumulates.
The water accumulated in the bilge, the bilge water.
Stupid talk or writing; nonsense.
The bulging part of a barrel or cask.
To spring a leak in the bilge.
To bulge or swell.
To break open the bilge(s) of.
To make dizzy, to bewilder.
Having a sensation of whirling, with a tendency to fall; giddy; feeling unbalanced or lightheaded.
definitions.example: I stood up too fast and felt dizzy.

definitions.definition: Producing giddiness.
definitions.example: We climbed to a dizzy height.

definitions.definition: Empty-headed, scatterbrained or frivolous; ditzy.
definitions.example: My new secretary is a dizzy blonde.

definitions.definition: A semi-tractor truck.
Energy, high spirits.
To inject with energy and enthusiasm.
A quantity of wood ashes, through which water passes, and thus imbibes the alkali.
A tub or vat for leaching ashes, bark, etc.
A jelly-like sweetmeat popular in the fifteenth century.
definitions.example: 1670 Hannah Woolley The Queen-like Closet, Or, Rich Cabinet https//en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Queen-Like_Closet "To make Leach and to colour it"

definitions.definition: An aquatic blood-sucking annelid of class Hirudinea, especially Hirudo medicinalis.
A person who derives profit from others in a parasitic fashion.
A glass tube designed for drawing blood from damaged tissue by means of a vacuum.
A physician.
(Heathenry) A healer.
The vertical edge of a square sail.
The aft edge of a triangular sail.
To purge a soluble matter out of something by the action of a percolating fluid.
definitions.example: Heavy rainfall can leach out minerals important for plant growth from the soil.

definitions.definition: To part with soluble constituents by percolation.
Resembling or characteristic of water.
Wet, soggy or soaked with water.
Diluted or having too much water.
(of light) Thin and pale therefore suggestive of water.
Weak and insipid.
Discharging water or similar substance as a result of disease etc.
definitions.example: I took my cat to the vet because I was worried about his watery eyes.

definitions.definition: Tearful.
A healthcare professional who is qualified or professionally engaged in the practice of acupuncture.
A flavoured beverage consisting of water, lemon, and sweetener, sometimes ice, served mainly as a refreshment.
A clear, usually carbonated, beverage made from lemon or artificial lemon flavouring, water, and sugar.
Recreational drugs of poor or weak quality, especially heroin.
A band for the hair.
definitions.example: She wore a bandeau in her hair.

definitions.definition: A band.
A narrow, tight bra, especially when strapless; hence, any women's top made from a similar band of fabric.

A stockbroking firm which takes small orders from clients and takes them on its own account rather than actually transmitting them to the market. Prevalent in the US 1870s to 1920s; often set up as shop-fronts in the 1920s.
A stockbroking firm which sells stock to clients when it has an undisclosed relationship with that company or its owners.
(travel) A travel agency selling discounted airfares, usually in defiance of existing minimum fare arrangements. Now usually refers to any small cheap agency.
A legal services firm selling heavily discounted legal services and documents made in large volume from boilerplate text and clauses, sometimes as a white labelled loss leader.
A company that sells coats of arms associated with the customer's surname, regardless of whether the customer can claim any relation to the original armiger.
On the aft side; in the stern.
definitions.example: The mate sleeps abaft.

definitions.definition: Backwards.
Behind; toward the stern relative to some other object or position; aft of.
A roommate.
A motorized rickshaw of South Asia and East Asia, often available for hire in the manner of a taxi.
A small ring.
A lock, tress.
definitions.example: Her hair was in ringlets.

definitions.definition: Any of various butterflies with small rings on the wings, in the tribe Satyrini of the family Nymphalidae, such as Aphantopus hyperantus.
To heat excessively.
To become excessively hot.
Excessively heated
An inn or similar establishment situated beside a road beyond the jurisdiction of a town or city.
A receiving house.

A closed curve, the locus of a point such that the sum of the distances from that point to two other fixed points (called the foci of the ellipse) is constant; equivalently, the conic section that is the intersection of a cone with a plane that does not intersect the base of the cone.
(grammar) To remove from a phrase a word which is grammatically needed, but which is clearly understood without having to be stated.
An organism that feeds chiefly on animals; an animal that feeds on meat as the main part of its diet.
definitions.example: As juveniles the crocodiles are frequently predated by larger carnivores.

definitions.definition: A mammal belonging to the order Carnivora.
definitions.example: The panda and the panther are both carnivores.

definitions.definition: A person who is not a vegetarian.
A kind of bird, many species of which are colourful and able to mimic human speech, of the order Psittaciformes or (narrowly) of the family Psittacidae.
definitions.example: I bought a wonderful parrot at the pet store.

definitions.definition: A parroter; a person who repeats the words or ideas of others.
definitions.example: What kind of a parrot are you? He just said that.

definitions.definition: A puffin.
Channel coal.
A transponder.
To repeat (exactly what has just been said) without necessarily showing understanding, in the manner of a parrot.
definitions.example: The interviewee merely parroted the views of her tabloid.

definitions.definition: A work of fiction that is shorter than a novella.
A whirlwind that forms over water, not associated with a mesocyclone of a thunderstorm (contrary to a true tornado).
A true tornado that passes over a body of water.
A channel through which water is discharged, especially from the gutters of a roof.
A recreational structure built among the branches of a tree
A tropical residence built in a tree, or on stilts
A thick, soft, usually woolen cloth resembling felt; often colored green and used for coverings on card tables, billiard and snooker tables, etc.
A coarse woolen material with a long nap; usually dyed in plain colors.
To cover or line with baize.
The wife of one's child.
The innermost membrane of the fetal membranes of reptiles, birds, and mammals; the sac in which the embryo is suspended.
A plant with simple stems, like bamboo or sugar cane, or the stem thereof
The stem of such a plant adapted for use as a tool
A rod-shaped tool or device, somewhat like a cane
Split rattan, as used in wickerwork, basketry and the like
A local European measure of length; the canna.
To strike or beat with a cane or similar implement
To destroy; to comprehensively defeat
definitions.example: Mudchester Rovers were caned 10-0.

definitions.definition: To do something well, in a competent fashion
To produce extreme pain
definitions.example: Don't hit me with that. It really canes!

definitions.definition: To make or furnish with cane or rattan.
definitions.example: to cane chairs

definitions.definition: Having spikes, spiny.
Hostile; standoffish
definitions.example: a spiky personality

definitions.definition: Of hair, erect, resembling spikes.
To succeed at something or meet a requirement; to be chosen out of a field of candidates or possibilities.
definitions.example: Out of a pool of twenty applicants, only 3 made the cut.

definitions.definition: A mouth or aperture, such as of a tube, pipe, etc.; an opening.
definitions.example: the orifice of an artery or vein;   the orifice of a wound;   the vagina and other orifices
